item.title: Crash @ "Surface Tension" on Manjaro Linux
item.dc:creator: tuna
item.description:
Although this isn’t a “fix” I was able to get past the crash by opening the terminal ("`" key) entered “sv_cheats 1” and then “noclip”.

I then Noclip’d through the blastdoors, turned noclip off and sv_cheats back to 0 saved & quit.

I returned to the game (so achievements could be turned back on) and was able to continue past the bug.

As I said clearly this isn’t a fix but if, like me you want to pass this - this will help.

Hope this gets fixed soon / helps someone.

item.description:
Howdy @RedEye!

Thanks for the help on the forums & on Steam!

Below is a C&P of what I posted on the Steam forums, thanks everyone.

Thank-you so much for taking the time and confirming there is a bug with that particular area of the game RedEye - I was worried it might have been an issue with my hardware…

I’ll link my specs both here and on the forums (as best I can, I give new meaning to the words ‘idiot’ and ‘noob’ heh).

  1. Manjaro Linux 17.0
  2. 4.9.16-1-MANJARO
  3. Intel® Core™ i5-3470 CPU @ 3.20GHz
  4. 15GiB (apparently?)
  5. VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GM206 [GeForce GTX 960] (rev a1)

As I said I’ll try those commands you suggested…

Quick question; do you -HAVE TO- blow up the helicopter in order to progress? Or is it an event that’s optional and you don’t need to blow it up?
I Ask because I was able to get down there and kill all the NPC’s but still cannot figure out for the life of me where it is I need to go…
I’m assuming you do in fact need to blow up the helicopter but I’m praying this isn’t the case…

either way thank-you again i[/i] for taking time to help me - I’m really enjoying this game so far and am bummed my progress has been halted.

All the best

-Matthew

UPDATE:

I tried

violence_hgibs 0
violence_agibs 0

and it still crashed sadly… Thanks for the suggestion though

item.title: Crash @ "Surface Tension" on Manjaro Linux
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
I thought the Helicopter crash bug was fixed in linux, but it would not surprise me if some systems still hiccup at that spot. This post from a developer makes me think that the fix has been pushed to the main version of the game, but I could be wrong and it still could be in the beta branch.
https://steamcommunity.com/app/362890/discussions/0/312265327168384714/?ctp=3#c154641879456230989

Regardless, the team is working on Linux and will continue to support it. https://steamcommunity.com/app/362890/discussions/1/340412628175324858/?ctp=2#c154645299384760935

Please provide your system specs, OS and driver versions.
For example:
Debian stretch
Linux 4.8.0-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.8.5-1 (2016-10-28) x86_64 GNU/Linux
i7-6700K CPU
32GB RAM
GeForce GTX 750 | nvidia-driver 367.57-2

I have seen a few suggestion to disable gibs for this crash, you might try this.
violence_hgibs 0
violence_agibs 0
https://steamcommunity.com/app/362890/discussions/0/282992562606326574/#c1843493219424430782

In case your saved game or autosaved game is corrupt try the following.
Restart the chapter by picking an unlocked chapter from the New Game menu.
Or you could just restart the individual map.
Type status in console, make note of the map name (example bm_c2a4c ). Then type “map bm_c2a4c” into console. This will start the map as a new game.
